intro: Pediomelum argophyllum, commonly known as the silverleaf pediomelum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has small, narrow leaves and produces daisy-like blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Pediomelum argophyllum is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
